Class RequestHandler

java.lang.Object
RequestHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class RequestHandler extends Object implements Runnable
Handles a single client connection and processes file-related requests on the server side.

Supports operations such as listing available files, serving file blocks for download, verifying file integrity via MD5, and registering clients as trusted peers for future sharing.

Each instance runs in a separate thread and manages its own socket connection. After processing is complete or the connection is closed, the socket is removed from the active list.

See Also:
  • TrustedClient
  • ServerFile
  • FileStorage

    files
    The list of files currently hosted on the server.

    The file storage manager used to access and serve file data.

    Reader for receiving text commands from the client (optional in single-command mode).
    private final Socket
    socket
    The socket associated with this client connection.
    private final Map<String,List<TrustedClient>>
    trustedClients
    The mapping of file IDs to trusted clients that have successfully downloaded them.
    private final PrintWriter
    writer
    Writer for sending text responses to the client (optional in single-command mode).

  • Constructor Details

    • RequestHandler

      public RequestHandler(List<Socket> activeSockets, Socket socket, FileStorage fileStorage, List<ServerFile> files, Map<String,List<TrustedClient>> trustedClients)
      Constructor used in interactive mode (command will be read from input stream).
      Parameters:
      activeSockets - list of currently active client sockets
      socket - client socket for this connection
      fileStorage - file storage for serving data
      files - list of files available on the server
      trustedClients - map of file IDs to trusted clients

    • RequestHandler

      public RequestHandler(List<Socket> activeSockets, Socket socket, BufferedReader reader, PrintWriter writer, String command, FileStorage fileStorage, List<ServerFile> files, Map<String,List<TrustedClient>> trustedClients)
      Constructor used in single-command mode (used for trusted client interaction).
      Parameters:
      activeSockets - list of currently active client sockets
      socket - client socket for this connection
      reader - buffered reader to receive commands
      writer - print writer to send responses
      command - initial command to process
      fileStorage - file storage for serving data
      files - list of files available on the server
      trustedClients - map of file IDs to trusted clients

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      The main execution method for this request handler.

      Read commands either from a socket stream or from a pre-parsed command, processes them, and sends responses. Cleans up and removes the socket after use.

      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • handleCommands

      private void handleCommands(BufferedReader reader, PrintWriter writer, DataOutputStream dataOut) throws IOException
      Continuously reads and handles commands from the input stream until the connection is closed.
      Parameters:
      reader - the input reader for receiving commands
      writer - the writer for sending responses
      dataOut - the binary data output stream for sending file blocks
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • handleOneCommand

      private void handleOneCommand(String line, PrintWriter writer, DataOutputStream dataOut) throws IOException
      Parses and processes a single command sent by the client. Handles listing files, downloading blocks, verifying file hashes, and more.
      Parameters:
      line - the command line input
      writer - the writer for sending responses
      dataOut - the binary stream for sending file block data
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O or parsing error occurs
